sentence.Network_en: The judge has the power to make discretionary awards.
sentence.Network_cn: 法官有权自行作出裁决,决定赔偿额.

entry.tran: 自由决定的;酌情行事的;便宜行事的
entry.def: Discretionary things are not fixed by rules but are decided on by people in authority, who consider each individual case.

example.ex: Magistrates were given wider discretionary powers...
example.tran: 地方法官被赋予了更广泛的自由决定权。

example.ex: Check whether you are entitled to a discretionary grant for your course.
example.tran: 确定你是否有权酌情行事。

means.word_mean: 1. having or using the ability to act or decide according to your own discretion or judgment;

sentences.sentence: "The commission has discretionary power to award extra funds"

means.word_mean: 2. (especially of funds) not earmarked; available for use as needed;
